title: Driver furious after being fined £100 for parking outside lines at retail park
text:

A driver was left furious after being fined £100 for parking outside lines at an almost empty retail park.

Jimmy Yoxall, 59, parked at the New Mersey Shopping Park in Speke, Livepool, to visit the B&Q store on Friday, September 27.

As he rushed to buy a new ladder at about 4.30pm - he parked across two parking bays in a spot surrounded by empty spaces.

But days later, Jimmy was shocked to receive a letter from a parking company demanding he pay them £100, reports the Liverpool Echo .

The car park is operated by parking control and enforcement company Park Watch, who are based in Chester.

(Image: Liverpool Echo)

The 'Parking Charge Notice' which Jimmy received from Park Watch demands a £100 payment within 28 days but the charge is reduced to £60 if paid within 14 days.

Speaking to the ECHO, Jimmy said: "When I first saw the letter I thought it was a joke. I thought it was someone trying to scam me.

"It's totally unfair and it feels like I've been violated.

"When I parked I was in a rush. I needed a ladder because one of my ceilings had collapsed and I needed to get back as soon as possible.

"When I used it there were hundreds of spaces left. The car park wasn't busy.

"It says in the letter that the signage is clear but it's not. The signs that are visible are about eight feet high and only one of the entrances has a sign.

"When I spoke to B&Q about it they were sympathetic to me but said they don't own the car park.

(Image: Rex Features)

"You shouldn't be going out shopping, parking in a car park and being scared of getting a letter through the door like this. It's not right.

"A lot of people would pay this out of fear but this shouldn't be the case.

"I want to make other people and other motorists aware of what these companies are doing. I want to stop this from happening to people with not a lot of money.

The letter from the company, which was seen by the ECHO, states: "The terms and conditions of parking on this private land are clearly set out on the signage installed within the car park.

"By parking within this car park the driver is bound to these terms and conditions and liable to pay a charge if they breach these terms and conditions."

Mr Yoxall said: "I went back to the car park the other day and I watched them do three cars in the space of half an hour.

"I'm not well off. This is a lot of money to me. There should be huge, clear signs but there aren't."

Park Watch were contacted for comment.
description: Jimmy Yoxall, 59, parked at the New Mersey Shopping Park in Speke, Livepool, where his car was surrounded by dozens of empty spaces
